ul.li: Display for the Integrated Control Panel (ICP).
Self-contained, electrically powered vertical gyroscope that displays aircraft pitch and roll attitudes.
Displays total fuel flow to the engine in pounds per hour, with a range of 0 - 80,000 pph.
Displays engine oil pressure, (0 to 100 psi).
Indicates the open/close position of the engine's exhaust nozzle as a percentage value.
Displays engine revolutions per minute (0% to 110%).
Displays exhaust gas temperature (EGT) in degrees Centigrade (200-1200Â° C).

area.title: Engine Fire / Engine Failure Split Warning Light

ul.li: ENG FIRE - Indicates an engine fire.
ENGINE - Illuminates due to an engine flameout, engine alternator failure, engine over-temperature, or other major system failure.
Low pressure in one or both hydraulic systems, or low engine oil pressure.

area.title: FLCS / DBU ON Split Warning Light

ul.li: FLCS - One or more FLCS malfunctions; refer to PFL.
DBU ON - FLCC operating in the digital backup mode.
Illuminates when the aircraft is configured incorrectly for takeoff or landing (LG not down and locked and/or Trailing Edge Flaperons (TEF) not fully down) and the aircraft is:.

area.title: Canopy / Oxygen Low Split Warning Light

ul.li: CANOPY - Canopy hooks or locks not secure.
OXY LOW - Regulator pressure has dropped below 5 psi or when the BIT detected a fault.
